alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 12:14PM CDT until July 20 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN MORGAN AND WEST CENTRAL SCOTT COUNTIES... At 114 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain still moving across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last few hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area during the next hour or two. Flash flooding is ongoing or could begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wartburg, Sunbright, Deerlodge, Rugby State Park, Rugby, High Point, Elgin, Robbins, Frozen Head State Park and Honey Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
